intro: Chrysanthemum subsimile, commonly known as the Japanese chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. It is widely cultivated for ornamental purposes and has cultural significance in many Asian countries. Chrysanthemum subsimile is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
